column9:
Wir haben schon in vielen B&Bs auf der Welt gewohnt. Aber so einen herzlichen Empfang wie bei Gabriella und Gianni haben wir sehr selten erlebt. 
Chiaia Bridge B&B liegt perfekt in der Via Chiaia und ist trotz seiner belebten Lage sehr ruhig. Das B&B befindet sich im 2. Stock und unser Gep√§ck wurde mit dem ausgekl√ºgelten ‚ÄûLastenaufzug‚Äú nach oben transportiert. Das gesamte B&B ist hell und mit viel Liebe zum Detail eingerichtet und √ºberall blitzsauber. Wir hatten ein sehr h√ºbsches Zimmer mit Blick auf die Via Chiaia, direkt an der Chiaia Br√ºcke. In dem Doppelbett mit den super Matratzen haben wir traumhaft geschlafen. Es gab noch ein extra Bett, das Zimmer w√§re ideal f√ºr eine kleine Familie. Das Bad ist super sauber mit Dusche, Toilette und Bidet. Es gibt einen F√∂hn und Pflegeprodukte. Das Zimmer wurde t√§glich sehr gewissenhaft gereinigt und auf Wunsch wurden sogar die Handt√ºcher gewechselt. Perfekter Service. Das WLAN funktioniert sehr gut auch in den Zimmern und es gibt neben dem normalen TV Programm die M√∂glichkeit √ºber den G√§ste Account Netflix zu schauen. Aber wer braucht schon Fernsehen. Es gibt so viel zu entdecken in Neapel.
Gabriella hatte sehr viele gute Tipps und war w√§hrend unseres 4-t√§gigen Aufenthalts sehr hilfsbereit und sehr liebenswert. Wir haben uns ehrlich willkommen gef√ºhlt. Zur Begr√º√üung gab es einen Piccolo und an Silvester einen Korb mit Leckereien und Snacks, sowie ein kleines Silvester Buffet im s√º√üen Gemeinschaftsraum ‚Äì und jedes Zimmer hat eine Flasche Prosecco geschenkt bekommen. Es sind neben Gabriella auch diese netten Gesten, die diese Unterkunft so besonders machen. Gabriella spricht gut Englisch und zur Not gibt es Google Translate. 
Im Gemeinschaftsraum wird t√§glich das Fr√ºhst√ºck serviert, mit einer gro√üen Auswahl an frischem, landestypischem Geb√§ck, aber auch Joghurt, Schinken, K√§se und typisch italienischem Mokka. Gabriella wohnt selber nicht in der Unterkunft, die aus vier oder f√ºnf Zimmern besteht, ist aber telefonisch immer erreichbar. Das B&B ist sehr sicher. Man wohnt auch in der besten Gegend von Neapel. Das Viertel Chiaia ist nur wenige Gehminuten entfernt. Dort findet man zahlreiche Boutiquen, hippe Bars und authentische wie auch schicke Restaurants in allen Preisklassen. Auch die Hafenpromenade mit zahlreichen Lokalen ist nur 15 Minuten zu Fu√ü entfernt. 
Wir kommen auf jeden Fall wieder und k√∂nnen diese tolle Unterkunft zu 100% weiterempfehlen. Wir haben sie geliebt.

Man blir f√∂rv√•nad n√§r man efter det relativt ruffiga trapphuset kliver in i ett litet B&B inrett i "shabby chic" stil, √§garinnan en hj√§lpsam, energisk glad tjej kom och gjorde frukost varje morgon i ett mysigt k√∂k, det k√§ndes v√§ldigt familj√§rt. Rummen var rena och fr√§scha. L√§get var toppen man kunde l√§tt ta sig till shopping, sev√§rdheter och t√•gstation. Att t√§nka p√• om man inte har starka ben √§r att det √§r tuffa trappor upp till andra v√•ningen i ett hus utan hiss. Det som gjorde att vi inte s√§tter toppbetyg √§r trapporna samt att de anv√§nde en v√§ldigt stark doft i luftrenare jobbigt om man har lite halvk√§nsliga luftr√∂r.

Wonderful place (elegant and commercial neighborhood), situation (in city center, near of restaurants, shops, caf√©s, ferries to Capri/Ischia/Procida), breakfast (you must try the cappuccino that Tonia prepare) and room (nice details, comfortable bed).
But, with all that, the best was the information, treatment and sympathy of the couple of hosts: Gabriella and Tonia.
Simply lovely

This small B&B (4 rooms) is run by 2 energizing italian ladies (Gabriella & Tonia). Rooms are clean, comfortable and  cosy. Altough the window has double glass, there is some noise from the street, so bring your earplugs. The breakfast is typical Italian with pastries & broad choice of italian coffee. The hosts are very helpful in giving tips to plan your visit to Naples and you get a list of the great authentic restaurants in the area. The B&B is very well located and 10mins away of the nearest Metro stop (Municioio). In short recommended for your short stay in Napoli!

Stayed at the Ponte di Chiaia B&B with a group of ten people for five days. I used to live in Naples so I know the area quite well and have stayed in many hotels there over the years.

Will start by saying the location of this B&B could not be better. It is very central to all sights, shopping, public transport, restaurants, etc. on a very popular pedestrian street. The B&B is actually a very large apartment (4-bed/3-bath/1 kitchen + lounge area) which can be reserved either room by room or in its entirety. The owners also have a separate 1-bedroom apartment in the same building which can be reserved.

The decor was not to my taste but the accommodations were comfortable enough. The website gives an accurate depiction.

The downer of this place is that the owner is a very unfriendly individual who does not seem fit for the hospitality industry. Number one issue is that she tried to overcharge us on multiple occasions - thankfully I had printed out the original emails with the quoted prices so she couldn't argue.  Something to keep in mind: they charge a nightly rate, plus a cleaning rate, plus gas, plus electricity, plus they demand full payment PLUS a refundable cash deposit at the beginning of your stay. And they don't accept any type of payment other than cash. Deposits must be done by bank transfer or by sending money through the mail which is an annoyance to say the least.

Next issue, the owner has furnished the apartment with antiques and other 'collectables' (read: tat) to which she is very attached. She ascertained that our group was untrustworthy because we had two small children with us. First we were ordered not to use any of the kitchen furnishings (plates, cups, etc). Then we were literally scolded for having moved some of the child-unfriendly items from the shelves to a safer location. Next she gave us a lecture on the prices of the antiques and then told us that she would do us the favor of taking them away so that we would not have to pay for them - because assuredly if she left them there, they would be damaged. And so she began removing furniture, wall hangings, decorative items, etc. from the apartment. 

I completely understand her desire to protect her valuables - and to be fair we were happy once these items were taken away. It was just her attitude that was so incredibly unkind and honestly she should just not rent the apartment to families and save herself the panic attacks. 

Other items of inconvenience: no storage for baggage, no parking, no privacy (the owner visits at will), very little English spoken, no internet access, no telephone, no elevator, and one very large fake palm tree in the middle of the living room which is in the way of everything but must not be moved!!

Summary: the accommodation is good value for money if you can stand the host. Personally I would not choose to stay there again.

Abbiamo passato un soggiorno stupendo, siamo stati ricevuti come dei re! Un ringraziamento particolare a Gabriella e Tonia che fanno tutto per rendere il vostro soggiorno perfetto fino al pi√π piccolo dettaglio. Ci siamo proprio sentiti a casa. Grazie e alla prossima :-)

Sono stato in vacanza con mia figlia presso questo B&B a maggio 2023. Ottima posizione e vicinissimo ai Quartieri Spagnoli. Cordialit√† e gentilezza da parte di Gabriella e Tonia fuori dal comune, che ci hanno fatto sentire subito di famiglia ( veramente splendide ). Camere pulitissime e ben arredate, colazione abbondante e servita direttamente dalle predette. Al nostro arrivo ci hanno subito offerto caff√® e soprattutto acqua ( visto il gran caldo ) e successivamente un elenco con locali tipici consigliati per pranzo e/o cena. Senz'altro consiglio questo B&B a coloro che volessero andarci. Per quello che mi riguarda, conto di ritornarci ( anche con tutta la mia famiglia ) al pi√π presto. Colgo l'occasione ancora per inviarle un saluto a Tonia e Gabriella. Sergio e Chiara da Trieste

Sono venuta qui con mio pap√†.
Il b&b √® in un palazzo storico in pieno centro.
Siamo stati accolti dalla signora Gabriella e successivamente da Tonia, entrambe delle bellissime persone, gentili e disponibili. Al nostro arrivo ci hanno offerto il caff√®, e dato tutte le informazioni per muoversi e riguardo locali tipici dove mangiare bene e pagare il giusto.
Colazione abbondante con prodotti tipici, la stanza molto bella, pulita e silenziosa.
Ottimo rapporto qualit√† prezzo.

B&b in posizione eccellente....pulito e con tutte le comodit√†! La colazione molto buona e abbondante e Gabriella e Tonia sempre gentilissime! Lo consiglio vivamente perch√© √® intimo e loro ti fanno sentire come a casa.

Mai scelta fu migliore. Su via Chiaia,posto centralissimo. 5 minuti a piedi dalla fermata della metro.Posto centrale, ottima zona per shopping e ristoranti e vicina alle principali attrazioni culturali.Molto vicino a Via Toledo. Struttura accogliente, molto pulita e molto carina nel suo stile shabby.Nonostante la zona sia molto frequentata,le stanze sono molto silenziose. Ottima e abbondante colazione con prodotti freschi e locali.Le proprietarie gentilissime, cordiali e simpatiche, pronte a suggerire itinerari turistici,pizzerie, ristoranti e negozi caratteristici e non.Consiglio decisamente!

B&B in una zona pedonale e tranquilla al centro di Napoli. Vicino alla Galleria Borbonica, all'elegante quartiere di Chiaia e dietro Piazza del Plebiscito, Il B&B √® curato in ogni minimo dettaglio, pulitissimo e la colazione ottima !!!! Le proprietarie sono estremamente cortesi e gentili. Consigliatissimo ! l'unica "nota" √® la mancanza di ascensore essendo all'interno di un palazzo storico - per i bagagli c'√® tuttavia un montacarichi!

Siamo tre amici e abbiamo soggiornato al Chiaia Bridge due notti, in occasione di un fine settimana a Napoli. Il B&B si trova in una bella zona della citt√†, ma in un palazzo vecchio, che ha scale molto usurate, che andrebbero prontamente riparate, per evitare cadute o incidenti, o brusche scivolate soprattutto in giorni di pioggia come purtroppo abbiamo trovato noi.  Manca anche l'ascensore e il bagaglio viene portato alle stanze tramite carrucola. Il piccolo appartamento dove sono state ricavate le stanze ci √® sembrato ristrutturato da poco, anche se le camere da letto ci sono apparse un p√≤ strette e scomode, soprattutto il lavabo e il bidet del bagno, minuscoli, forse pi√π adatti a bambini, che ad adulti. Nota di merito la ricca colazione e la pulizia delle stanze, ma crediamo sia il minimo per accogliere decorosamente il turista. Carine e gentili le due ragazze che a mattine alterne ci hanno preparato la colazione, poco empatica e distaccata la titolare del b&b, propensa ad accettare solo complimenti alla sua struttura e per nulla attenta a cogliere nelle critiche rivolte, i suggerimenti per migliorare un servizio, che dovrebbe essere sempre dalla parte del cliente. Cos√¨ alle segnalazioni di scuri che non si chiudevano e di infiltrazioni d'acqua nel pavimento, la titolare non si √® limitata a dire "mi dispiace", ma ha prontamente elogiato le note positive del suo b&b, la colazione, la pulizia, la posizione, "rinfacciando" anche il fatto che aveva dovuto chiedere alla cameriera di arrivare prima la mattina, dato che noi avevamo esigenza di mangiare presto, per rispettare un appuntamento preso con altri. Insomma l'impressione che ci ha lasciato questa esperienza √® che nonostante i lati positivi che avremmo potuto apprezzare di questo b&b, la titolare non abbia accettato nessun tipo di critica, che era stata rivolta al solo scopo di migliorare un servizio. In ogni caso Napoli ci √® piaciuta e torneremo, in altra struttura per√≤.

Abbiamo soggiornato dal 16/02/23 al 18/02/23 che dire posto magnifico!!! Accoglienza super da parte di Tonia!! Ci siamo sentiti subito a casa.. la camera √® arredata in maniera molto curata, il soggiorno in cui si svolge la colazione( ricca e buonissima) √® fantastico ci si sente davvero a proprio agio!! Ci ritorneremo sicuramente grazie davvero di tutto!! 
Servizio transfert di cui abbiamo usufruito al üîù. Consiglio davvero questo b&b 

Giulia, Domenico e Riccardo

Mio marito ed io abbiamo soggiornato per due notti in questo bed and breakfast che si trova proprio a due passi da Piazza del Plebiscito, Palazzo reale, Galleria Umberto e molti altri punti di interesse della citt√†.  Ci√≤ che ci ha colpito, appena entrati, sono stati il gusto nell'arredamento e la pulizia impeccabile,ma,  non appena abbiamo conosciuto le nostre ospiti, la Signora Gabriella e la Signora Tonia siamo stati piacevolmente avvolti dal calore della loro accoglienza. Perch√© al Chiaia Bridge ci si sente come a casa, come quando si passa a trovare amico e questi ci apre la casa e ci offre un caff√®. La colazione, varia e abbondante, consta di pasticceria fresca, yogurt, succhi, pane salumi, formaggi, e poi caff√®  e cappuccino, e bevande calde per tutti i gusti preparate al momento con amore. S√¨, l'amore, perch√©  questo √®  ci√≤  che abbiamo percepito nella cura di tutti i dettagli: l'amore per ci√≤ che si fa, il sapere come fornire la  migliore ospitalit√†. Consigliamo questo piccolo angolo di pace e bellezza a tutti coloro che visitano la splendida Napoli.  
Grazie. 
Laura e Angelo

Il nostro soggiorno presso il Chiaia Bridge B&B √® stato fantastico. La struttura si trova in una posizione perfetta al centro di Napoli, in via Chiaia, a due passi da Piazza del Plebiscito. Le camere sono nuove, ben arredate, pulite ed accoglienti. Ma la vera differenza la fanno i proprietari/gestori del B&B, di un'ospitalit√† e gentilezza uniche. Gabriella, Tonia, Claire e Gianni hanno reso il nostro soggiorno memorabile, fornendoci informazioni utili e consigli su dove mangiare bene, ed intrattenendosi con noi a colazione, che viene servita con paste fresche (sfogliatelle, cornetti, etc.) - una vera delizia. Non possiamo fare altro che consigliare di soggiornare presso il Chiaia Bridge B&B a Napoli, dove torneremo sicuramente. Al Chiaia Bridge B&B ci si sente a casa! Eleonora e Silvio

Weekend a Napoli con il mio compagno. Abbiamo deciso di prenotare al B&B Chiaia Bridge viste le ottime recensioni e la posizione.
Il B&B √® bellissimo, arredato in stile Shabby Chic, curato nei minimi dettagli. 
Molto pulito e accogliente. 
I proprietari sono delle persone squisite e disponibili.
La colazione buonissima.
La posizione del B&B √® strategica perch√© permette di raggiungere facilmente, a piedi, i punti di maggior interesse di Napoli.

Ci siamo sentiti a casa. Torneremo sicuramente a Napoli e sceglieremo nuovamente il B&B Chiaia Bridge.

Arrivando da Ischia al Chiaia Bridge ci attendeva la dolcissima Claire che ci ha aiutato a issare le valigie con un ingegnoso montacarichi. ( unico neo, manca l'ascensore) .Il B&B √®  carinissimo, molto pulito, camere ampie e colazione super!  Pur affacciandosi sulla via del passeggio ilB&B √®  silenziosissimo. Un applauso a Claire per la sua dolce disponibilit√†!

Che dire! 
Zona perfetta per visitare il centro e il lungomare, camera carinissima, Tonia e Gabbriella super ospitali e super disponibili a darci tutte le informazioni utili per visitare Napoli!
Grazie di cuore

Situato in una posizione ottimale e con una conduzione impeccabile. Molto attente ai particolari, cortesi, gentili ed ospitali le titolari. Ogni giorno pulizie in camera. Confortevole e ben arredato. Colazione abbondante con dolci tipici e salata.

Delizioso e confortevole b&b in stile "shabby and chic" situato in un palazzo "vecchia Napoli" (senza ascensore), in una delle zone pi√π chic della citt√† e situato in posizione strategica a due passi dall'elegante via Filangeri, piazza del Plebiscito, Palazzo Reale, teatro San Carlo e non lontano dal lungomare.

Io e la mia amica abbiamo soggiornato bella camera divisa in due zone, una con letto matrimoniale, l'altra con letto singolo. Soluzione molto comoda.
Massima pulizia sia in camera che nelle parti comuni.

Gabriella √® una padrona di casa accogliente e premurosa che, oltre a fornire informazioni sulla citt√†, fa trovare a colazione sfogliatelle e "pastarelle" varie.
Ammirevole tanta professionalit√†, seriet√† e attenzione verso il cliente, non sempre scontate in un b&b.

ASSOLUTAMENTE CONSIGLIATO

Ottimo b&b in posizione centralissima e silenzioso, confortevole e gestito da persone molto attente al cliente, super consigliato.  Ho ricevuto tanti buoni consigli su dove mangiare o fare acquisti, la colazione molto buona.

B&B molto carino, pulito e ospitale. I proprietari Gianni e Gabriella e la sorella di Gianni sono stati molto accoglienti e carini. La colazione abbondante permette di scegliere vari prodotti tra i quali torte e dolci tipici sempre freschi. La posizione √® strategica e presto, ho notato, sar√† raggiunta anche da una fermata della metropolitana in costruzione. Ovviamente al momento serve una piccola passeggiata dalle due fermate della Metro : Municipio o Toledo. Unico neo l‚Äôassenza di un ascensore. Per me e mia moglie nessun problema ma per chi avesse problemi di deambulazione diverrebbe un ostacolo visto che il B&B √® situato al terzo ed ultimo piano del palazzo con scale antiche non propriamente regolari. Ma di questo non √® responsabilit√† dei proprietari. La stanza √® spaziosa ed arredata con semplicit√† ed eleganza. Da consigliare

Tra il 1500 ed il 1600 Domenico Fontana, a seguito della espansione edilizia,  realizz√≤ Via Chiaia per collegare Piazza del Plebiscito con il litorale marino .
Per collegare, invece, la collina di Pizzofalcone con quella delle Mortelle fu costruito, nel 1636, dal Vicer√© Conte di Monterey il ponte di Chiaia per ‚Äú facilitare le comunicazioni necessarie alla sociabilit√† ed alla commodit√† di tutti i cittadini ‚Äú, e per cui fu chiamato  ponte Monterey. Per raggiungere il livello superiore della strada di Chiaia fu eseguita, invece, una ripida rampa che and√≤ subito in notevole degrado e sempre malfrequentato.
Nel 1834,il ponte , per problemi statici, fu restaurato da Orazio Angelini in stile neoclassico, cos√¨ come √® attualmente, che presenta sul lato di piazza S. Ferdinando, interessanti fregi in marmo, raffiguranti fanciulle alate, eseguiti da T. Angelini e G. Cal√¨, mentre sul lato opposto, verso piazza dei Martiri, due cavalli marmorei, opera di Tommaso Arnoud.
Il torrino laterale del ponte ospita il vano scala-ascensori che collega via Chiaia alla zona di Monte di Dio. Al centro appare lo stemma dei Savoia che  ha sostituito quello dei Borbone dopo l'Unit√†. Sotto il ponte sono presenti due lapidi che riguardano la costruzione e l'abbellimento ottocentesco: uno riguarda Philippo IV regnante ed il secondo  Ferdinando II regnante.
Si tratta di un ponte imponente che valorizza la strada anch‚Äôessa ‚Äúimportante‚Äù !

Camera pi√π che decorosa e molto tranquilla (unico neo: qualche problema col televisore).
Colazione: pur annunciata solo come "continentale", era ottima sia per la quantita' che per la varieta' dei prodotti offerti.
Personale gentile e disponibile (a differenza di quanto avevo letto nella recensione in inglese presente sul sito).
Garage francamente un po' lontano; quando pero' mi √® stato spiegato che potevo raggiungerlo utilizzando l'ascensore pubblico del ponte di Chiaia, ho dimezzato i tempi scoprendo anche un angolino caratteristico del centro napoletano.
Posizione: ineguagliabile: si √® veramente ad un tiro di schioppo da quasi tutto cio' che conta a Napoli.

Ottimo b&b in posizione centralissima e silenzioso, confortevole e gestito da persone molto attente al cliente, super consigliato.  Ho ricevuto tanti buoni consigli su dove mangiare o fare acquisti, la colazione molto buona.

B&B molto carino, pulito e ospitale. I proprietari Gianni e Gabriella e la sorella di Gianni sono stati molto accoglienti e carini. Location parfaite pour visiter Naples √† pied. Quartier anim√© tr√®s sympa . Le  B and B est d√©cor√© avec go√ªt, tr√®s propre, il y a un acc√®s √† Netflix. Les propri√©taires tr√®s sympas et √† l‚Äô√©coute de leurs clients. Un 10 ++ √† Valentina , la parfaite polyglotte qui nous a servi le petit d√©jeuner et qui nous √† laiss√© des douceurs dans la chambre avec de gentils petits mots.

Tonia en Gabriella zijn TOP gastvrouwen. De dames doen dit met hart en ziel, geven je een instant welkom gevoel. Hun enthousiasme is zeer aanstekelijk en geeft je van bij het ontbijt een happy gevoel. De ligging is perfect. Ruime, mooie en propere kamers. Goede bedden. Eenvoudig maar correct ontbijt geserveerd met een warme drank naar wens vers gemaakt door √©√©n van de gastvrouwen. Gabriella had zelfs de laatste dag een overheerlijke taart gebakken voor bij het ontbijt.
Wij hadden alle kamers in gebruik en de douche van kamer 4 is "te klein" alsook hangt er en dat was blijkbaar in alle kamers soms een onfris geurtje. Maar dat weegt niet op tegen AL de rest.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Nice welcome, friendly staff, willing help when it was needed. Spacious rooms, and the place  is situated in the heart of Napoli. The owner is a nice lady who prepares  a small breakfast herself. But you can get better coffee in the nearest cafe

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Clean and quiet with very pleasant service.  The door locks are something of a challenge, but futz with them a little and they‚Äôll probably work.  Breakfast was kind of meh, but the croissants were good.  Excellent location.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: The room is a good size with an en suite and plenty of room to store things. There is a full kitchen with microwave, toaster and a hob. Lovely location which is right next to the main line and only a 5 minute walk to the main strip. Made our holiday activities very easy to get to and only 25 mins from Naples International.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
We stayed here for 2 nights in January. 
Pluses:
- Fast, free wifi
- Soo comfortable memory foam beds with EXTRA QUILTS
- Clean, quiet, secure
- Just steps from the University Metro stop, and a nice takeway Italian cafe
- Excellent location, walking distance to Spaccanopoli, and all sights
- Lots of outlets
- Large, airy, yet Italianate rooms
- Free breakfast, which includes eggs and ham if you ask!
- Very friendly staff
- Great price point for such a great little B&B

Minuses:
- We had a late arrival, and I had to nudge the staff 3 times on WhatsApp to be able to check in after hours.Communication needs work.

Overall, HIGHLY recommend!!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Excellent find in a location which is just about perfect for exploring the city. Metro stop right outside, oh and a bar and pizzeria! Friendly staff and a good simple breakfast, clean and comfortable. Recommended.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
A friend from Naples recommended this place for a weekend stay. I was contacted before hand by the owner to say that check in was from 13:00. I responded to say that with my flight arriving at 11:30 would it be possible to check in early. The owner responded immediately to say that would not be a problem.
The location of the B&B is within easy walking distance of the port (for ferries to Ischia, Capri etc) and of the main sights inn the centre of Naples. Its also positioned right beside one of the Metro stops.
The room was clean and very comfortable, with good sound proofing on the windows to keep out the noise of the Naples traffic. 
The owner was very helpful in providing advie on what to see, where to eat and the cost of taxis.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
We spent three nights in Fredericas B& B. The standard was as good as in a good hotel. Because of Al Italias overbooked Flight we came very late but we kept contact with Frederica who waited for us. The room had charm, the bathroom was well equipped and the breakfast ü•ê  was excellent. The location was great, near to the boats for Capri, next to subway station University. 
Definitely a good place to stay in Neaples.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: ..and nicely decorated (a matter of personal taste). The B&B has a good location, you can reach by foot all main touristic objectives in max 15 min. The noise is typical Napoli and I doubt that in a central location you get an accomodation without noise. We did not have a problem to sleep. Federica, the owner, is very nice and helpfull. Breakfast is good, home made cakes. I reccomend it.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
As soon as we arrived Federica was waiting for us. She is very kind and helpful. Our room was very nice, we loved it; our balcony led to one of the sides streets which I particularly like! 
Nice decoration! As regards the bathroom, there we had shampoo, soap, shower cap and towels which are changed daily if needed :) 
We really liked breakfast! Federica's cake is DELICIOUS! Breakfast is served from 8.30 to 10.30 and you may have cake, madeleines, muffins, ham and cheese, toasts, juice and of course your selfmade Nespresso! 
The place is very clean and tidy. Besides, the location is perfect for starting your walking tours around the city! It's close to many points of interest! I totally recommend this B&B. 
Enjoy!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
We visited Naples with my partner's Mum and Dad and we loved the area so much that we have decided to revisit Naples and Sorrento on our honeymoon this year, and that includes a return stay at Federica's FANTASTIC B&B. Her service was sublime and very attentive, lots of help and advice and the apartment was always spotless - the kitchen/breakfast room seemed to be deep cleaned every day. I can't understand the criticism of breakfast as the choice was vast with lots of different juices and yogurts, cereals, meats and a great selection of fresh cake. The location is excellent, directly next to a tube station and a taxi rank and the noise is exactly what you would expect in a city. We had the Borgo room which was lovely and the huge shower was a real treat. Also very close to the old town and some fantastic restaurants (Federica recommended Tandem which is directly behind the hotel and serves the best ragu you will ever eat for a pittance!)
Thank you Federica and team, we will be back

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Siamo una coppia e abbiamo soggiornato a "I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast" dal 17 al 21 Luglio. Devo dire che il soggiorno √® stato pi√π che positivo a partire dal bel posizionamento della struttura molto vicino alla metropolitana e al centro della citt√† di Napoli per gli spostamenti; mentre per quanto riguarda l'accoglienza √® stata particolarmente calorosa da parte di Melania molto carina, professionale e disponibile per tutto. La struttura all'interno √® molto romantica a partire dalla camera accogliente, con aria condizionata, pulita e molto curata nei dettagli e per finire con una abbondante colazione continentale soprattutto con dolci tipici fatti in casa. Non ho nulla da ridire perch√® √® veramente bello come posto ed essendo all'interno di un condominio, spesso alla porta c'√® anche un guardiano per la sicurezza e questa cosa √® molto apprezzata. Nel complesso siamo stati benissimo e se i prossimi anni verremmo di nuovo a Napoli sapremo dove alloggiare (sicuramente sceglieremo un periodo migliore per via del troppo caldo che √® stato a Luglio quest'anno). <3

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Abbiamo soggiornato due notti in questo b&b a due passi dal porto e da Spaccanapoli. Bella la stanza "baia", molto pulita e con un materasso comodissimo. Ottima la colazione, molto varia e con torte fatte in casa e cornetti caldi. Gentilissime sia Melania che Federica a consigliarci i posti da visitare e dove mangiare. Ho apprezzato moltissimo il fatto di poter lasciare i miei bagagli dopo il check out e poterli ritirare nel tardo pomeriggio. Fermata della metro sotto il portone. Ci torneremo prestissimo. Super consigliato.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: La   struttura √® situata in una zona tranquilla vicino al centro. Il B&B √® accogliente e pulito, la camera grande , buona la colazione ottima posizione vicinissimo alla fermata della metro. Personale molto gentile. Lo consiglio

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
Abbiamo soggiornato 4 notti in questa struttura, siamo rimaste molto soddisfatte: stanza spaziosa e pulita, materasso comodissimo, bagno con ampia doccia. Stanza molto insonorizzata: anche se si affaccia sulla piazza del comune e sullo stradone, non si sentono rumori, come non si sentono le altre stanze del B&B.
Colazione a buffet molto buona.
Un ringraziamento speciale a Federica, che √® sempre stata molto disponibile e ospitale!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Questa struttura √® stata una piacevole sorpresa. Posizione strategica sia per muoversi a piedi che per prendere i mezzi, la fermata della metro √® a pochi passi dal portone. Tutto molto funzionale per visitare e vivere Napoli. L'alloggio √® pulito e accogliente, ci si sente come a casa; ottima la colazione che comprende anche dolci fatti in casa. Vivamente consigliato.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
La struttura ha una posizione stra comoda sia per i mezzi che per accedere a piedi ai luoghi di interesse. Ma questo non √® il solo punto di forza di questo b&b..le camere sono ampie,pulitissime e vengono rifatte tutti i giorni!
La colazione √® strepitosa.
Al mattino senti il profumo delle brioche appena sfornate, ci sono torte fatte in casa, frutta fresca,salumi, tutto di ottima qualit√†. Per me la colazione √®  stata  un momento molto piacevole, gestita direttamente dalla host
Melania,molto simpatica, che cura ogni particolare con attenzione e professionalit√† per far si che il cliente trascorra un piacevole soggiorno; per me questi aspetti fanno la differenza, quindi lo straconsiglio e se torno a Napoli andr√≤ di nuovo ai "racconti di partenope"

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Siamo stati 2 notti e siamo stati bene. Il palazzo √® antico, le stanze al 2¬∞ piano ma con ascensore. Non venire in macchina! Non c'√® modo di parcheggiare. Aria condizionata, frigo bar etv, c'√® tutto quello che serve. La notte per√≤ la movida un o' si sente.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
Situato di fronte alla fermata della fermata metro Universit√†, questo B&B √® molto confortevole e accogliete.
Dalla stazione centrale √® molto comodo da raggiungere con due fermate di metro e, con altrettante o con 10/15 minuti di piacevole passeggiata, si raggiunge il centro.
Ho soggiornato qui due volte di cui una con un bambino di 1 anno e debbo segnalare che, trattandosi di un palazzo storico, dal portone principale all‚Äôingresso del BeB il percorso con il passeggino non √® proprio agevole: ci sono 4 gradini da salire nel cortile e altri 4 per prendere l‚Äôascensore.
Il quartiere √® molto vivo, l‚Äôinsonorizzazione della camera √® abbastanza buona e non abbiamo avuto fastid√¨ di alcun tipo durante la notte.
Sotto il BeB c‚Äô√® un buon bar dove poter mangiare qualcosa: nella piazza ci sono altri ristoranti che per√≤ sconsiglio.
Non sempre c‚Äô√® qualcuno per l‚Äôaccoglienza, ma la proprietaria lascia tutte le istruzioni per poter entrare a qualsiasi ora. 
La colazione √® un po‚Äô peggiorata rispetto al primo soggiorno che ho avuto modo di trascorrere in questo BeB: ora viene servita a tavola (prima era a buffet), ma c‚Äô√® decisamente meno scelta e la qualit√† del cibo √® inferiore.
Tutto sommato il rapporto qualit√† prezzo √® molto buono.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
B&b molto molto carino e comodo.
Raggiungibile a piedi dalla stazione passeggiando per circa 20min oppure in metro, la fermata e‚Äô proprio sotto al b&b.
Le ragazze che lo gestiscono sono splendide, gentili e cortesi, attente alle necessit√† del cliente.
Offrono una colazione ottima.
Stanza e zona colazione molto pulite.
Comodo per raggiungere a piedi spaccanapoli, piazza del plebiscito, quartieri spagnoli e il centro storico.
Regalano un soggiorno splendido!
Consigliatissimo e sicuramente ci torneremo!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9:
In piazza Bovio a Napoli, in una bella zona centrale, anche se devo segnalare che la fermata della metro Universit√† al momento non √® agibile... si trova questo B&B al primo piano di un palazzo residenziale.
Sono 4 camere tutte molto belle, dotate di bagno privato e aria condizionata.
Al mattino le ragazze - molto simpatiche e disponibili a dare consigli per la visita della citt√† - servono la colazione in una stanza all'uopo predisposta.
Grazie dell'accoglienza!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Non ho trovato una esatta corrispondenza tra le foto del sito web e la struttura, poich√© quest‚Äôultima √® nettamente pi√π bella di presenza. Il b&b ha 4 camere da letto molto spaziose con bagno privato ed una sala colazione altrettanto spaziosa. L‚Äôarredamento √® stile shabby chic,  finemente curato nei minimi  dettagli. Melania e Federica, le amministratrici del b&b, sono attente alle esigenze degli ospiti, gentili, simpatiche, cordiali e, soprattutto, servono una colazione abbondante e succulenta con cornetti caldi e torte, da loro preparate. Il b&b si trova all‚Äôinterno di un antico palazzo, in posizione centralissima, facilmente raggiungibile ed ha la fermata della metropolitana posta ad appena qualche passo dal portone. Che dire di pi√π: CONSIGLIATO!!!!

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Prenotazione effettuata tramite Booking per 2 notti con cancellazione gratuita e come specificato dalla struttura ‚Äú nessun addebito verr√† effettuato ‚Äú . Peccato che il giorno dopo mi vengono comunque prelevati 200 euro dalla carta . Contattata la struttura mi viene detto che √® solo una preautorizzazione , peccato che i soldi prelevati sono ancora bloccati e comunque non nella mia disponibilit√† da 4 giorni ormai . Quindi che senso ha scrivere ‚Äúnessun addebito verr√† effettuato ‚Äú se comunque i soldi vengono presi o bloccati comunque per giorni ?

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Ho prenotato questo b&b il 11 gennaio per il sabato successivo, 18 gennaio, perch√© mia figlia tornava dall'estero e volevo andare a prenderla all'aeroporto di Capodichino. column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Dopo aver cercato numerosi b&b per Napoli, questo √® risultato il migliore sotto tanti punti di vista, in quanto a parit√† di prezzo (se non di meno) offre pi√π servizi rispetto agli altri. Si trova di fronte l'uscita della metro (sarebbe pi√π semplice da trovare mettendo anche un'indicazione, perch√® il civico cos√¨ come il palazzo risulta coperto a prima vista). La proprietaria si √® dimostrata fin da subito gentilissima e disponibile in ogni nostra richiesta, aspetto alquanto importante per poter soddisfare ogni nostra esigenza (poter lasciare i bagagli dopo il check-out e venirli a prendere in un secondo momento). La stanza sempre molto pulita e ordinata, letto molto comodo, doccia superlativa (camera Posillipo), bagno dotato di phon e tutto il necessario. La colazione √® molto abbondante e gustosa, il WiFi sempre funzionante, nessuna pecca di alcun tipo. Molto soddisfatta.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Nel we dell‚Äôepifania insieme alla mia famiglia abbiamo soggiornato presso questo b&b rimanendo assolutamente soddisfatti sia della stanza sia della posizione nella quale √® ubicato: di fronte al b&b si trova la stazione metro ‚Äúuniversit√†‚Äù che ti permette agevoli spostamenti. A pochi passi c‚Äô√® anche la fermata ‚Äúaugusteo‚Äù della funicolare che collega agevolmente con il Vomero. Si trova davvero in una posizione strategica per visitare il centro di Napoli. Inoltre offre quattro stanze tutte comode, qualcuna pi√π spaziosa dell‚Äôaltra, ma tutte con bagno in camera, arredate con gusto e molto pulite. Federica, la titolare, sebbene non dimori nel B&B, √® sempre disponibile e presente. Ottime colazioni abbondanti. Ho gradito molto una particolare attenzione avuta nei nostri riguardi: sapendo che nostro figlio beveva solo un tipo di latte, si √® premurata ad acquistarlo per farglielo trovare a colazione. Ottimo rapporto qualit√† prezzo. Consigliatissimo.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: Durante lo scorso fine  settimana abbiamo soggiornato per due notti presso questo centrale e comodissimo b&b. La camera era molto spaziosa e accogliente. La struttura √® ubicata in posizione strategica per raggiungere anche a piedi i principali monumenti d'interesse; la fermata della metropolitana e' anch'essa comodissima e adiacente alla struttura. Consigliamo di soggiornarvi...

column9: Bella ed ampia stanza con parquet e ben arredata , materasso molto comodo, bagno grande e moderno con ottima doccia, molto pulito, proprietaria molto gentile e discreta, buona la colazione, zona centrale davanti a fermata metro. Qualit√† superiore a un 3 stelle.

column2: I Racconti di Partenope Rooms & Breakfast
column9: We hebben hier een heerlijke week beleefd. De kamer was ontzettend leuk ingericht en super schoon. Het was elke avond weer een feestje om terug in de kamer te komen. De locatie is perfect! Ook het ontbijt was elke ochtend prima. Simpel maar zeker goed! De gastvrouw was ontzettend aardig en behulpzaam. Ze maakte op onze laatste ochtend speciaal voor ons een uur eerder ontbijt klaar ivm onze terugreis. Een warm welkom staat hier voor je klaar en we kunnen het absoluut aanbevelen. Alleen maar lof üòÅ

We stayed in Pantarei B&B for our Naples layover on the way to Sorrento. Virginia was so helpful on reaching out to me via WhatsApp to ensure I had the address. She kindly offered to reserve us a parking spot in a car park just 4 minutes away. She was unable to check us in on the day, so her charming parents showed us to our room and showed us everything we need to know. 

The room is perfect. Fresh and clean, as was the bathroom. Virginia provided us with plenty of tips on where to eat locally. The B&B is well located so that you can make your way into the bustling old town, or down to the front. 

It was the ideal spot for our quick trip!

We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay in this lovely B and B which is in a great location to explore the sights of Naples. 
It is only about a 15 minute taxi journey from the airport and is in a nice quiet area. Virginia greeted us with a very warm welcome and kept good communication with us on WhatsApp, advising us of some nice places to eat and places to visit.  Our room ‚ÄòShabby‚Äô, had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The little kitchen area was great for making hot drinks and snacks if required. 
There is a metro station just down the road which is very useful and nearby bus stops to pick up excursions to Pompeii , Vesuvius etc. 
Warm croissants, cereal, fruit , and crisp breads are offered for breakfast from 8 am. 
 We highly recommend a stay here for your visit to Naples!  Thank you Virginia ! üòÅ

La posizione √® ottimale , vicino al centro storico e comodissima con il collegamento per l'aeroporto

Virginia persona gentile e pronta a darci tutte le informazioni utili per muoverci nella citt√†. Se qualcuno mi chiedesse dove alloggiare senza dubbio io e mio marito consiglieremo questo posto. La posizione centrale aiuta sicuramente, vicinissimo al porto e alla fermata Universit√† della linea 1
Prezzo modestissimo, la struttura dispone solo di due camere, quindi √® una gestione altamente familiare quella che contraddistingue questo b&b. Colazione spettacolare, camere spaziosi, cura del dettaglio e pulizia ottima
Il punto forte per√≤ sono i titolari: il padre,presenza discreta e mai invadente, e soprattutto Virginia (sempre disponibile sia di persona sia tramite whatsapp per poterci seguire al meglio con numerose proposte culinarie e di itinerario)

Giuseppe e poi Virginia, la figlia, che vi accompagna tramite whatsapp per tutto il soggiorno. Accertandosi che vada tutto bene sia nella struttura che nel soggiorno o scoperta di Napoli. Certo non pu√≤ evitare la fila da Sorbillo, ma √® veramente una persona unica; mai incontrata, nei miei viaggi, un'attenzione al cliente cos√¨! Grazie di cuore, Cesare

Per chi ha intenzione di visitare Napoli consiglio vivamente questo B&b.

In 20 minuti circa si arriva alla struttura a piedi, situata sulla strada principale quindi facilmente individuabile. Ottima ospitalit√† del proprietario condita da utili informazioni sul come muoversi in citt√†. Camere pulite, ben arredate, silenziose e calde. La struttura √® praticamente in centro a 100 m dalla metro a 5 minuti da piazza blebiscito e via Toledo. Inoltre si √® vicinissimi anche a spaccanapoli e la Pizzeria Sorbillo.
All'andata siamo arrivati a piedi ma consiglio di prendere la metro in stazione e scendere alla prima fermata ovvero Universit√†.
Ultimo punto a favore, abbiamo potuto lasciare i bagagli in struttura oltre il check out. Tutto perfetto insomma.

Accogliente, curato nei particolari, elegante e funzionale. Ogni dettaglio non √® lasciato al caso.Molto pulito.

Tout √©tait parfait ! La propret√© de la chambre est impeccable, elle est confortable et bien situ√©e, l‚Äôimmeuble est s√©curis√©, le petit d√©jeuner est bon avec des produits frais (fruits, p√¢tisseries, jus de fruits frais, et machine √† caf√© ultra perfectionn√©e avec caf√© latte, macchiatto, cappuccino). Virginia √©tait aux petits soins pour nous, et on a m√™me eu des petits cadeaux :)

A delightful B&B ‚Äì actually a series of 6 serviced apartments in a block. We had the room called ‚ÄòCapri‚Äô and it was excellent; spacious, a comfortable bed, excellent air conditioning (necessary in temperatures of 29-31 C) plenty of storage and a good view of the port. We stayed for 3 days and then came back for another day after a flotilla sailing holiday. 

Our hosts, Antonio and Luisa were warm, very kind and especially helpful. They were highly entertaining (good English speakers, as was their son) and always checking that we were enjoying ourselves. Their restaurant suggestions, including La Poeta in Posillipo, were superb. Breakfast is tailored to what you want and the pastries are delicious.

If you‚Äôre likely to use the port, for example to travel to the Amalfi coast or the Pontine islands, it‚Äôs very convenient ‚Äì a 5 minute taxi ride away. The airport is about 20 minutes if you avoid busy commuting times. Across the road is a fabulous caf√© ‚Äì Bar Gilda (try the granita di limone) and a delicatessen and restaurant. A Conad supermarket is literally next door.

Zonaporto is at the bottom of the Centro Storico, an area with many of the city‚Äôs most interesting sites. We recommend the Capella San Severro, with astonishing sculptures that look like they have been draped in cloth, plus the Duomo and the beautiful and vast coolness of the Museo Archeologico Nazionale, which houses an incredible array of statues and artefacts from Pompeii and Herculaneum. Walking down Via Tribunali emphasises the hustle and bustle (and vivacity) of Neapolitan life.

If you do nothing else, take a ferry to Procida and eat at Sottosopra ‚Äì left off the ferry and keep going to the end of the shops and restaurants.

We stayed here for two night and were very happy with our choice.  We were hosted by the lovely Louisa and Antonio who were both very friendly and welcoming.  The rooms are very nice and clean, the bed is comfortable and the breakfast was very good.  It is in a great location too.  We would definitely recommend this place.  
Grazie Louisa and Antonio!

We stayed in Yellow room; Comfortable room, with a view towards the port. 
Not really a romantic view, but not ugly one, and very interesting, especially during night.

The room was clean and large, with large twin bed and big cupboard. There was enough powerplugs for all the gadgets you needed to recharge, and power outlets also had USB connectors. 

Bathroom was spotless, large, and well lit, with roomy walk-in shower. Accessories were provided, including hairdryer. 

WiFi and AC worked perfectly. 

Breaksfast was good, partly made by hosts on the spot. There was always a cake (sweets for breakfast are typical for southern Italy), excelent coffee, various bagles, selection of fruits. There were variations from day to day, but usually it was a combination of continental and southern italian sweet breakfast. 
Fridge in teh kitchen is stocked with drinks and fruits, and they can be cheaply purchased on Honor box system. 

Hosts were friendly and helpful, with a lot of information on the neighbourhood. We felt like at home. 

#Zonaporto is located in a residential building on a sixt floor. It does not look flashy from the outside, but it is very cosy when you get in.  Location is good base for exploration of the city. Metro station and port are both five to ten minutes of walk away, as well as the final stop of the airport shuttle.

It took us second pass before we found the building; B&B sign is located inside the loby, next to a reception booth. Trust the navigation Apps to lead you straight to building (or just enter the tall building on the corner, right around the corner from the store) :)

There is a private parking in the yard next door, for 20 EUR a day.

Zonaporto is wonderful. It is close to everything, near to the train station and Spaccanapoli the street that runs down the middle if the historical part of Napoli. Luisa and Antonio are kind and generous hosts. Luisa took the time to show me some of the important spots. It is clean and comfortable with a wonderful homemade cake for breakfast. I

Ho soggiornato presso questa struttura per quattro notti a fine ottobre. I proprietari sono gentili e molto disponibili. Le stanze sono tutte finemente arredate e curate nei minimi dettagli. Soggiorno consigliato, colazione spettacolare!

Welche ein herzlicher Empfang! Allein die wertvollen Tipps seitens der proprietaria sind f√ºnf Punkte wert. Neue, saubere Struktur mit L√§rmschutzfenstern. Hier sind Fachleute am Werk, die sich mit viel Freude um das Wohl ihrer G√§ste k√ºmmern. Ein herzliches Dankesch√∂n!

A top relaxing place able to blend refined environments with the warmth of hospitality and the taste of the best Neapolitan pastry-making.
If you are looking for a properly organized spot that makes you feel immerged in the heart of the city and, at the same time protected from chaos, this is definitely the right one.
Looking forward to come back again!!!

We stayed here for my husband‚Äôs birthday. They gave us great advice, and provided a wide selection for breakfast. We want to go back in Summer to do one of their organised boat tours!! Definitely the best choice for us, and great value!

This lovely B&B is situated in a beautiful building in a really central location close to the main train station, airport bus and the centre of town.  Our room was extremely comfortable and tastefully decorated with everything you need.  Breakfast is laid back with a wonderful selection to choose from each morning.  Arturo, the host is the star of the show and gave us several top tips for navigating Naples.  Would definitely return!

A fantastic modern apartment on the 3rd floor. Room was comfortable and cosy. The owners of the b&b are both very friendly and helpful people. They both helped us identify places of interest to go and visit. Very helpful. I would highly recommend staying here and would return in a heart beat. Brecfast is ready every morning and it a relaxed atmosphere. We couldnt be happier with our 5 night stay.

My husband & I stayed here for just one night last weekend. 
The couple who own this place couldnt be more helpful, giving us recomendations for restaurants and for travel. 
The apartment is fabulous, absolutely spotless with a very large shared space with a small balcony. 
The rooms were good size, with lovely high ceilings and nice decor. The power shower was brilliant. 

There is a small kitchen area where you can use the fridge and coffee machine.  

We had a lovely breakfast here also. 

I can't recommend this place highly enough for such good value for money. We were sorry we were only staying for one night. 

Thank you for a lovely stay in Naples.

Myself and my fianc√© had a two night stay at this wonderful hotel. Very central to the train station and city centre. Hotel facilities brilliant. Comfortable bed, excellent shower. Use of coffee machine. Breakfast laid out for you every morning. Hosts are very VERY friendly. They sat down with us with a map and pointed out where to go, and what the most interesting places to see where. Very safe and secure hotel. Sad to be leaving. Would definitely come again.

My wife and I spent 4 nights here in early July, the building is a residential block accessed by a small lift. The room we had over looked the street but the noise was minimal due to the shutters and the window glazing.
The owner Arturo and his wife are really friendly and helpful and gave us some great information on where to go, where to eat, etc. he is a very genuine and helpful man.
This location is within a short walk of all of the attractions of Naples and the ferry terminal to Capri and the islands.

We stayed 3 nights in Napoli and we loved our stay at Vicere B&B. The place is located in a quiet area near the center (5 minutes walk from the Via dei Tribunali, 15 minutes walk from the station Garibaldi where you can take a train to Pompei and its surroundings). The B&B is beautiful, bedroom is well equiped, spacious and really clean. It felt like home. Arturo and Alessandra took very good care of us and were really nice. We woule definitively recommend this place to everyone willing to visit Napoli. Grazzie !

This review echoes everyone else's in that the location is brilliant and the owner very helpful and friendly as was the house cleaning lady. The B and B was comfortable (although my husband was too tall for the bed) and really clean with restful decor.The lift is really cute too. We didn't give it 5* only because the bathroom was teeny although we did see another bathroom which was lovely. We were just unlucky.

What a lovely spacious and comfortable room and bathroom . Common utility area which could be accessed at all times. Good safe location.  easy walking distance to most places. Quaint lift to carry up the luggage. Safe box. Extremely clean. Good breakfast including alessandra's lovely baked goods
Wonderful hosts alessandra & arturo. He sat us down and explained things about the B & B, places to see and eat in Naples.
Would stay here again for sure. 5 stars for everything.

Moderne, nette kamer en B&B. Uiterst vriendelijke en behulpzame gastheer. Correct Italiaans ontbijt. De hele dag koffie, water en thee. Alles op wandelafstand bereikbaar, maar ook de metro is erg dichtbij.

Und dass sich dieses Hotel in den H√§nden von Nonnen befindet, erkennt man nicht nur daran, dass ab und an eine von ihnen √ºber einen Korridor huscht, sondern auch an der zweckm√§√üigen Einfachheit, Schmucklosigkeit der gesamten Einrichtung nach Art bestimmter Jugendherbergen.

Villa Albina, is a small villa, surounded with beautiful gardens, hidden in a nice area of Napoli, Vomero, a bit far from the centre, but well connected with metro and feniculare. Many nice shops and restaurants in the area, aswell as a couple of great supermarkets.
Excellent breakfast, very good staff at the reception! We hired and car, so it was a plus that they provide free and secure parking in the hotel

I have stayed at Villa Albina twice. This hotel is wonderful! Quiet, super clean, gentile. The breakfast is beyond generous and the staff is perfectly professional. The location is lovely! Tree lined streets only steps away from the cafes, restaurants and shopping area.

Everything was perfect, the room was very clean, the place was generally quiet and well adorned with necessary equipment. Breakfast was everything one needed and more, the staff were ever so helpful ~ Parking was an essential in Naples, and this was exceptional service with the gates opening on a video request and everything was very secure once inside... 10 out of 10!! I would use this accommodation again.

I was pleasantly surprised staying here for a few days. It is not a luxury hotel of course and it is an ex hospital so it is quite different in its style and layout but it is professional, SUPER clean, with a modern touch to the rooms. What I really liked about this place is that your privacy is very respected! The staff are honest, friendly and professional and if they should need to speak to you they will call your room like a professional hotel should! 

I have had many experiences here in Vomero and Napoli at hotels and bnbs that have absolutely no respect and the rude owners come knocking at your door if they need something and disturb your peace. This is somewhere that I felt at extreme peace and tranquility and I was not bothered at all. It is in a tranquil street only less than a 5 minute walk from the cafes, shops and everything you need in Vomero. If you are on a business trip or just a general trip looking for a clean room, peaceful stay with friendly staff that do not disturb you and somewhere very close to everything that you need I would definitely recommend here! A good experience!

Spent 2 nights in this very nicely renovated villa. Room was clean and functional. Conveniently located in Vomero, with plenty of places for food & drinks. Breakfast is typical Italian, so don't expect a copious buffet. 
I'm pretty sure I'll be back

Rooms not so big but cleaned every day, good localization (the Vomero borough), near the metro station.
The hotel provides breakfast only but there are lots of restaurants in the nearest area.
Very good place to stay :)

We have been Villa Albina  FOR  1 OVERNIGHT  last sunday, we found a clean and friendly hotel. Beside the appearance, it was a private hospital in the past, the hotel offers  a super clean environment as well as  a quiet atmosphere although you are in the middle of one of the most crowded commercial streets of the city. Everything is at hand, shops, cinemas, teathre, nice walking area as well as the transportation means ( metro and cable cars ). The hotel offers a  wide parking . Breakfast was satisfying as well as the general services and reception support. The best place to stay in the Vomero  residential area.

The villa is located in Vomero - the best place to stay in Naples if you have a car. It has its own parking which is critical in Naples, metro station and 3 funicular stations are just 5-7 minutes walk. You should leave a car as far from the center as possible because the traffic is hellish, 
The interior is simple but the room is large and has everything which is necessary.
Breakfast could be better (if includes at least cheese, eggs etc.) but this is not critical

Ottima ubicazione per visitare Napoli. Situata al quartiere Vomero si trova questo hotel ricavato da una ex clinica. Camere spaziose e pulite. Menzione particolare alla gentilezza e disponibilit√† del Direttore e di tutto lo staff. Consigliato

Abbiamo soggiornato due notti in questo hotel. Posizione perfetta per visitare Napoli, vicino alla funicolare che porta in via Toledo. Parcheggio interno chiuso da cancello, personale gentilissimo! Assolutamente da consigliare per visitare Napoli!

Posizione ottimale di questa ex clinica delle partorienti, ti consente di andare a piedi per il Vomero ovunque. 
I nei sono rappresentati da: 
1) un odore di detersivo che permea sia la camera che il bagno, difficili da eliminare d‚Äôinverno quando la temperatura esterna non consente una lunga aereazione della camera;

Buona colazione con ottimi caff√® e cornetti. Di buona qualit√† i salumi, formaggi e succhi di frutta.

Migliorabile

Posizione ottima a due passi dalla funicolare che porta in Via Toledo, ma al Vomero, quindi fuori dalla confusione, in collina ed in zona signorile.
Camera nuovissima e grande come un appartamento, pulitissima e molto silenziosa.
Buona piccola colazione.
Personale gentilissimo.

Ottima posizione in via tranquilla al Vomero, a due passi dalla via centrale con i bar, ristoranti e area pedonale; comodo anche per i trasporti pubblici , luogo fresco, personale gentilissimo, colazioni buone, pulito, letti comodi.

The location is absolutly perfect, you can walk everywhere and there are subway stations around the corner. Even the funiculare to Castel Saint Elmo isn't far. This structure is located 100mt from Metro and a walking distance from major attractions.
Rooms are nice, refurbished recently. The host offers a glass of wine and a nice common area on a terrace to enjoy the fresh air.

Enjoy your staying

Ideal stay, perfect location and beautiful rooms! The rooms were clean and comfortable with the terrace an extra bonus! Frederica was a brilliant host she went above and beyond to make us feel at home and her tips and recommendations were greatly appreciated. Overall a fabulous stay and would highly recommend especially with such a reasonable price!

10 points for the location,could not be more centric!The rooms are brand new very well decorated and there is also a small terrace that can be used for breakfast or night drink:)Federica was a sweetheart, available at any time and helpful!

The room was small bet warm and perfectly equipped. Francesco has efficiently welcomed and assisted me, giving very useful suggestions about the city. The hotel is located between the old city and the China neighborhood and is perfect to visit the city

Antonio greeted us with a friendly smile and warm cup of expresso after we arrived soaking wet from a rain storm. He went beyond helpful in offering tips, suggestions and searching for addresses and places for us. The room is large, sparkling clean and has all the accommodations needed along with a few personal touches that made this a memorable experience.

The hotel is located in the historical center of the city which is the best place to stay in. The stuff was very helpful, kind and nice. The room is small but was enough for us (couple). The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was in a local bar near the hotel you get a great coffee and pastry.

My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and am so glad we found this gem.
Firstly the location is perfect. Right on the edge of the historic town, it is a short walk to some gorgeous sites and bustling streets. It is also a short walk to the port which was handy when travelling to sorrento and some of the islands. We felt really safe and comfortable here. 
The rooms are clean and well decorated and have really comfortable, large beds. The bathrooms have a range of towels and toiletries and a nice large shower.
Breakfast in the cafe next door was a pastry and delicious coffee and you can sit outside at your leasure. 
But one of the best things about this B&B is the staff. We were made to feel so welcome and they couldn't do enough to make our stay special. They were informative and friendly at all times. 
I would HIGHLY recommend this for a stay in Naples.

Excellent place ! Very clean and spacious ! Antonio was very helpful and friendly ! He showed us where to go and gave us some recommendations on where to eat . Everything is pretty much walkable , location is great. Breakfast is right beside and you get a pastrie with a coffee or juice .

Nonostante la posizione super centrale, e nonostante fosse la notte di capodanno, non abbiamo avuto disturbi di auto e/o altro.

Wir haben hier 4 N√§chte verbracht. Daniele, der Gastgeber, hat uns am Flughafen abgeholt - da wir gerne direkt zur Unterkunft gelangen wollten, war das die beste und schnellste Alternative zum Alibus (Flughafen-Bus). In der CasaPacifico angekommen haben wir uns gleich wohlgef√ºhlt - die Zimmer sind so wie auf den Bildern (oder sogar noch nen Tick besser) - wir hatten das gr√∂√üte Zimmer gebucht - mit einer Badewanne und Blick auf den Platz. Das Zimmer hatte eine wunderbare Gr√∂√üe, das Badezimmer war richtig schick - inklusive Dusche - und das Bett war sehr gem√ºtlich. Einziger Punkt - durch die Stra√üenn√§he ist ein gewisser L√§rm auch im Zimmer zu h√∂ren. 
Morgens gibt es um 9 Uhr das typische italienische Fr√ºhst√ºck - s√º√üe St√ºckchen und Saft. F√ºr uns ausreichend - da die Stadt kulinarisch wirklich alles bietet! Wir haben uns in die Stadt, die Kultur und K√ºche verliebt. Napoli muss man kennenlernen - denn es gibt viele sch√∂ne Ecken (und einige nicht so empfehlenswert). Das B&B liegt in der Altstadt - alles ist gut erreichbar - kurze Wege zu Restaurants und Bars. 

Am Anfang haben wir von Daniele wertvolle Tipps f√ºr Restaurants erhalten, die wir auch ausgetestet haben - lecker! 

Wir k√∂nnen diese Unterkunft sehr empfehlen - vor allem wegen der Sauberkeit und der Herzlichkeit der Gastgeber. F√ºr Napoli ist diese Unterkunft auch Luxus!

Great view from our room. Danielle was very helpful, during our stay he gave us lots of recommendations via Whatsapp. There is free wifi, the room was spotless, the location is within walking distance to the best restaurants in Naples and the shower was amazing. Great value for the price we paid.

Unfortunately, I lost my room key during my stay and let him know at 2pm. He got me a replacement key and said I will owe $40 which I agreed to pay.
He waited until 10:30pm while my wife and I were asleep to call me 4 times after he knew my wife and I were leaving for the airport at 4am, yelled and demanded I pay him for losing the room key. I assured him I would pay him the following day but since I did not have cash to leave and did not know how to do a bank transfer, he said he would show up at 11pm to knock on my door and demand payment. He was very aggressive about it as well, saying it was my fault and I‚Äôm the reason we had to deal with it at 11pm. I agreed it was my fault but that it didn‚Äôt have to be dealt with when we were trying to sleep. It made my wife feel very uncomfortable. I have never been treated so unprofessionally anywhere I have stayed. I definitely will never stay here again and will not suggest it to anyone.

We stayed here for 1 night in April, from the outside you feel like you‚Äôre in old Napoli with the 500 yr old door opening up to a big courtyard and a tiny European lift, once inside the rooms are spacious and modern, high ceilings, very quiet and super comfortable beds, a lovely Italian breakfast is served in your room and you have your own espresso machine. Our host Daniele was so warm friendly and helpful, location is good, we walked from Garibaldi Centrale, would definitely stay here again.

Our room was amazingly clean and quiet with a beautiful view of the church next door. The location was great (don't miss exploring the other side of Via Foria - Palazzo dello Spagnolo). Daniele, Giggi and the hourekeeping team were extremely helpful. We hope to be back soon!

Air conditioning didn't work in 1 of our 2 rooms, and barely worked in the other (We had to sleep above the sheets). So instead we packed 6 people (including two elderly, and two young children) into one room because their only solution was we should use a fan (it was August!). Then they only offered a 20% discount on the room we couldn't and didn't use. Lastly, super "awesome" sleeping with 6x family members and having an interior window that looks directly into the shower!

Don't let the lack of lift and external appearance fool you. This place and the owner are truly lovely. The rooms are more like suites, with a modern contemporary feel. Each has a little seating area out front and the bed and pillows were (for me) by far the most comfortable of the holiday. This really was the surprise of our holiday. Excellent location in relation to the town, the stations and its only a few mins from the ruins.

Contemporarily designed hotel with large rooms and good guest service. My friends and I stayed at this property for two nights and were quite pleased with our stay. Rooms are reasonably priced and boast of modern colors such as mustard yellows, deep blues, and more. Daniele (the owner) greeted us upon check-in and gave us a list of nearby restaurants to try, which was extremely helpful. The exterior of the hotel is being renovated, so the initial impression may be a quizzical one, and there is construction work being done, so guests may hear construction. However, everything is done to ensure that guests have a great stay, and we did.

The room here was lovely, very spacious and clean with all the modern amenities of a contemporary hotel. The only aspects the room could improve on were the water temperature and additional drinking water in the mini bar (one bottle between two guests didn't seem enough). We experienced 10 or so minutes without hot water, but other than that the room was very good.

If you stay at this hotel, it is important you keep in touch with the reception/host when you arrive into Napoli (Naples). We didn't do this and we found it difficult to find the hotel by ourselves. The hotel is nestled in a residential area of which share the same main door to Casa Pacifico, once through the door there is an old lift which takes you up to reception. 

Breakfast is an option of a continental tray brought to your room or a reservation for a neighbouring cafe. We opted for the first option as we had a flight to catch and it suited us well, croissants, yoghurt and Italian coffee, a good set up for the day.

We stayed at Casa Pacifico for one night in September 2020 and loved it! The room was spacious, modern and clean, and the people at reception were friendly and helpful. Stefania has been very responsive and has helped us figure out our stay in Napoli by answering our questions via text (both before and during our stay). Thank you!

Posizione molto strategica comoda per arrivare ovunque ,pulizia accurata e gentilezza dello staff.Il design √® molto particolare tutto curato nei minimi.Anche il parcheggio √® funzionale e se si ha voglia di camminare da l√¨ √® facile arrivare nei luoghi pi√π tipici di Napoli!

Ho passato un fine settimana nel comfort e nella comodit√†. Posizione ottima, facilmente raggiungibile anche a piedi dalla stazione e non lontano dal centro e dalle principali "attrazioni". Personale gentile e sempre disponibile. 
Super consigliato

Location nel cuore di napoli.  
Praticamente un hotel a 5 stelle.
Casa Pacifico occupa un  piano all interno di un cortile caratteristico di Napoli.

Sehr zentral und ein wunderbarer Gastgeber Bruno.
Hier w√ºrden wir immer wieder gerne √ºbernachten. Sauber und ein prima Fr√ºhst√ºck.
Bruno gibt gute Tipps und hilft sehr gerne weiter.
Als Ausflug ist Procida sehr zu empfehlen.

Sehr sch√∂nes B&B. Liebevoll eingerichtet und gut gelegen. Der Besitzer, Bruno, ist sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Allerdings habe ich nicht ausprobiert, ob er auch Deutsch kann :-). Das B&B liegt an einer Seitenstrasse sowohl des Corso Umberto I als auch der Via Duomo, also ganz prima f√ºr Ausfl√ºge in die Altstadt. Nat√ºrlich ist es nachts etwas laut, wenn man mit offenem Fenster schl√§ft. Aber das geh√∂rt zu einer Grossstadt. Und gegens Treppensteigen darf man nichts haben. Ich war schon zweimal da und w√ºrde wieder dieses B&B w√§hlen.

I stayed at the B&B for one night from.
Bruno was the best host ever: so friendly, helpful, full of great tips. The B&b is so nice and clean, comfortable and homey. I would recommend it to everyone! Thank you so much Bruno!

Great location to explore the city and old town. Easy access to the mainline, metro and circumversuvium rail systems to travel further afield - Pompeii, Casterta, Herculaneum and Sorrento.
Bruno, the owner, met me on arrival and was a great host throughout my stay.

Very clean, comfortable bed and near everything. Bruno the owner is very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this B and B to anyone. The place has 3 bedrooms in total so very quien. The building is very sabe with 3 security doors to open.

I really liked the B&B, which is at the edge of the old town, within walking distance to the central station, to the harbour and to the metro. Very well placed, and no problem walking home late.
Bruno is a nice and helpful host, who helped with my heavy suitcase.
Good breakfast, fast Wi-Fi, a shelf in the fridge, aircondition in the rooms and connected to the kitchen a small balcony with two chairs and a table.
There is only three rooms, so people will not be coming and going all night. There is some noise from the street, but this is Napoli.
The only problem is that the B&B is on the 3rd floor (American 4th) and there is no elevator/lift.
I stayed for 14 days!

Perfect location in Naples for exploring the city and old historical parts. 10 minute walk from the main train station. 10 minute walk from the port for excursions to Capri etc. Easy to organize a trip to Vesuvius and Pompei from here. Bruno was a great host and was very helpful. Great breakfast and advice each day. Lots of stairs to negotiate every day but apart from that A1!

We spent two nights at B&B Quattro Palazzi and wish we had had time to extend to a third night. It's just a fifteen minute walk from the train station, and then only a few minutes from centro storico and other tourist areas. The neighborhood is safe and quiet, and the room is clean and comfortable. The best part of the stay is the host, Bruno, who is thoughtful, knowledgeable, and friendly. He met us more than a block away from the B&B, carried our bags up the stairs, and gave us a thorough description of good sites to see during our brief stay. Bruno is incredibly attentive, which makes staying in Naples easy and enjoyable. We'll stay here again next time we visit.

This is an absolutely lovely little guesthouse. It's spotlessly clean and comfortable, and Bruno is such a great host. He helped us carry our bags up the 3 flights of stairs, and gave us advice about Naples and a map, as well as looking after our bags the following day and allowing us to collect them later on - he went above and beyond. Breakfast is simple and delicious and Bruno makes fresh lattes etc for you.
The guesthouse is about a km walk from the station along bumpy pavements, but it's simple to find, and much better to stay here near the old town than up by the station where it can feel pretty dodgy especially at night.
Naples incidentally is a fantastic city and well underrated. Spend a few days!

This was a great place to get a feeling for how Napolians live and was a true B&B. I stayed in the sun room. Breakfast was good and the owner was super nice and helpful. There are a lot of stairs involved, but it's in a great area of the city.

The Quattro Palazzi is about a kilometer away from Napoli Termini so it can still be a bit of a walk but it is a great location.  Bruno is a wonderful host and is really an all around guy.  He was there to welcome me mid-afternoon even if he is usually at the B&B in the mornings only.  He helped carry my suitcase through 4 flights of stairs [it's an old building with no elevator which is the only downside for me].  Place is great [there are only 3 bedrooms with their own bathrooms], clean, quiet despite the ongoing metro construction a short block away [so this will be even easier to access in the future from the metro]. Centrally located between the port, old town, the metro and the spanish quarter.  Bruno is there every morning for breakfast promptly at 8am and then he cleans all the rooms after we have gone.  He tries his best with recommendations and is very accommodating of requests even if he apologizes for his English.  Even the day I left, he was there attending to me, helping get a taxi on what turned out to be a nearly impossible day to get a taxi [Saturdays]. Wifi is strong and for all of Naples reputation, the neighborhood felt safe.  Bruno was also very clear on warnings and suggestions, what I had to be wary of and how to ensure I stay safe from pickpockets.  And since I was always the first one up in the morning, I did manage to chat with Bruno every day who was always ready with a smile and suggestions. I stayed 5 nights.

We stayed here 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Bruno is a great host and was very helpful for us in understanding how to get around the city. The one down-side is that the neighborhood is noisy (that's Naples), but with the window closed it was not a problem. Highly recommended!

Tutto perfetto. Host cordiale e disponibile, camere belle, pulite e gradevoli e super colazione. Tutto perfetto. Da ritornarci assolutamente e poi siete al centro di Napoli, a pochi passi dai decumano e dalla stazione. Complimenti lo consiglio

B&B gestito dal cordiale, paziente e attento Bruno che sa dare le giuste dritte. Pulito e con una variegata colazione, anche se nello standard. Molte scale da salire, belli gli scalini in pietra e il corrimano in ferro battuto, purtroppo, per√≤, senza ascensore; ma il fatto di essere cos√¨ in alto garantisce un certo silenzio. Bruno sar√† pronto a intercettarvi al vostro arrivo e a portarvi i bagagli pi√π pesanti.

Consiglio il pernottamento presso questo beb. Pulito, silenzioso, posizione strategica, ottima colazione, Bruno √® molto accogliente e disponibile a dare spiegazioni su come muoversi in citt√†. Ci piacerebbe poter tornare. Grazie.

La scorsa settimana sono tornata per l'ennesima volta a napoli per trascorrere alcuni giorni di relax, torno sempre volentieri nel b e b di bruno, mi sento come a casa, si trova  a poca distanza dalla stazione e dal centro. Le camere sono nuove, pulite, accoglienti, il bagno e' spazioso e munito di ogni confort. La colazione e' una vera delizia, abbondante e varia, consiglio a tutti il cappuccino e' ottimo! Io e il mio ragazzo abbiamo trascorso un fine settimana a Napoli tra fine aprile e inizio maggio, per venire a trovare due miei cari amici. Questo bb √® situato in una zona centrale, a pochi minuti dalla stazione, ma in una zona tranquilla e girabile la sera tranquillamente (a due passi da via duomo, l universit√† o via mezzo cannone). Noi alloggiavamo nella stanza "sole": camera dotata di ogni comodit√† essenziale: letto matrimoniale, un tavolino e una sedia, televisione appesa al muro, armadio e bagno in camera, con doccia, condizionatore per l estate. Colazione abbondante e ricca nella variet√† di scelta (dalle brioche calde, alle fette biscottate, due plumcake fatti in casa appena sfornati, e bibite in volont√†). L'unico difetto che posso trovare √® il fatto che ci siano un sacco di rampe di scale da fare (non c √® l'ascensore e il bb √® all'ultimo piano), quindi non lo consiglierei agli anziani. 
Soddisfatta e contenta. Il prezzo √® di trenta euro a notte pi√π tassa di soggiorno.

La stanza √® ricavata in un appartamento, e vi sono in totale tre stanze. La nostra, ma direi tutte, era molto pulita, accogliente, completa di tutto. Il bagno privato era anch'esso completo. La colazione era ottima e abbondante (fatevi fare il cappuccino!), e Bruno √® una persona squisita. Ottima tra l'altro la posizione, in una zona dove si pu√≤ tranquillamente girare anche di notte e molto tattica per raggiungere molti posti turisticamente interessanti. Prezzo onesto. Ci siamo trovati benissimo, grazie e a presto!

Le petit d√©jeuner vari√© est r√©ellement suffisant. Bruno, la personne qui g√®re cet h√©bergement est un jeune dynamique, bienveillant, √† l'√©coute et r√©ellement gentil. L'emplacement est parfait, √† proximit√© du port pour partir sur les √Æles, √† proximit√© de la gare centrale pour visiter la c√¥te et √† deux pas du centre historique, ses √©glises et ses trattoria.
